UIL RMA Portal/UIL RMA Portal/
School Administrators,

Thank you for your patience as we work to navigate this ever-changing and unprecedented situation. As the situation stands, all UIL contests are suspended through March 29 due to COVID-19. As new information is released, we will continue to make informed decisions and provide amended plans as we have them.

We have received several questions concerning rehearsals, practices and spring football. At this time, all rehearsals, practices and workouts conducted outside the school day, as well as spring football, are postponed until March 29. This means that no rehearsals, practices or workouts outside the school day can be conducted during the time period of March 16 through March 29.

In the case that spring football is canceled altogether, football workouts would resume on August 3rd and teams would be able to add an additional scrimmage.

As this is a rapidly changing situation, please look for future correspondence from UIL.

Thank you,
Jamey Harrison, EdD
UIL Deputy Director

Colt Richter receives Mohrmann's Drug Store's "Pay It Forward" Award

Gonzales Elementary student, Colt Richter, was named the recipient of the "Pay It Forward Program" sponsored by Mohrmann's Drug Store for the month of March. Ms. Angelica Raley and Mohrmann's Drug Store initiated a Pay It Forward program this school year. The goal of the program is to recognize and nominate students with good citizenship characteristics; "identifying dependable students who are doing the right things when others aren’t looking", per Ms. Raley. Colt Richter was awarded a certificate of recognization at last night's GISD School Board meeting as well as was granted a $100 donation to the organization of his choice. Colt chose the Gonzales Animal Shelter to receive his contribution.

Thank you, Ms. Raley and Mohrmann's Drug Store for your continued support.

Tealer's Jersey to be Retired at Friday's Apache Basketball Game!

Dennis Tealer was inducted into the Texas High School Basketball Hall of Fame on May 18, 2019. The Gonzales Boys Basketball program will be retiring Dennis’ jersey on January 10, 2020, vs Poteet at home. We would like to invite you and to spread the word that the induction will take place immediately following the girls’ varsity basketball game (7:30-7:45 pm).

Dennis Tealer led the Gonzales Apaches to the 1974 state championship game. As a three-year starter and three-time All-State player, he averaged 18 points per game in his sophomore season and 24 points as a junior. During his senior year, he averaged 29.4 points and 18 rebounds per game.

Photos courtesy of Gonzales Inquirer.

Frank Benes Received "Pay It Forward Program" for GHS

Gonzales High School student, Frank Benes, was named the recipient of the "Pay It Forward Program" sponsored by Mohrmann's Drug Store. Ms. Angelica Raley and Mohrmann's Drug Store initiated a Pay It Forward program this school year. The goal of the program is to recognize and nominate students with good citizenship characteristics; "identifying dependable students who are doing the right things when others aren’t looking", per Ms. Raley. The program focuses on students at GJH and GHS. Every six weeks, the two campuses alternate nominating five students who display such positive characterships. Mohrmann's Drug Store then selects one recipient. GHS was the chosen campus for the month of December. The chosen recipient, Frank Benes was awarded a certificate of recognization at the monthly GISD School Board meeting as well as is granted $100 donation to the organization of his choice. Frank Benes chose Norma's House to receive his contribution.

Thank you, Ms. Raley and Mohrmann's Drug Store for your continued support.

GISD earned a B rating! We are extremely proud to share the annual TEA state accountability rating for this past school year. After a tremendous amount of work and effort put forth from students, parents/guardians, the community as a whole and GISD staff and personnel, it proves true, hard work and dedication does pay off! GISD is excited to announce we have advanced from an “F” rating from the 2017-2018 school year to a rating of a “B” for the 2018-2019 school year.

The district as a whole is rated as well as each individual campus.

TEA’s State Accountability System is an extremely complex system that is comprised heavily on STAAR and end-of-course (EOC) exams. GISD will continue the academic initiatives that were implemented to obtain such growth in student achievement and will strive for continued improvement. To gain a better understanding of how the ratings are calculated, you can view the full accountability manual at https://tea.texas.gov/a-f/.

Thank you Sequoya Janacek, East Ave teacher, for sharing this heart warming experience:

Kameron Ramirez's uncle Joseph Camarillo (a graduate of Gonzales High School), was stationed overseas during the first semester of the school year. My class wrote him letters while he was there. He was unable to write back as it took too long to get the letters before he returned home. ( we mailed the letters in September and it was the beginning of December before he received them). He returned home on vacation and was able to come visit our class. He told the students he got their letters and appreciated them very much. He also told them he was able to fly a flag in honor of our class and will send it to us when his belongings arrive back in the states. The students were able to ask questions like what it was like where he was at, what kind of food there was, and what his job in the Army was.
